Key Match Events: The Timberwolves had six first-quarter turnovers, disrupting their offensive rhythm.
The Lakers had 15 offensive rebounds, contributing to their early lead.
The Lakers outscored the Timberwolves 72-40 in the paint.
A 17-2 Lakers second-quarter run was a turning point in the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Timberwolves coach Chris Finch noted the team's disjointed offense and lack of ball movement.
Anthony Edwards emphasized that making open shots could have changed the game's outcome.
Julius Randle took personal responsibility for the rebounding issues and emphasized the need to clean up small mistakes.
Chris Finch mentioned the need to simplify the game plan and improve defensive resistance.
Others: Julius Randle played his first regular-season game after shoulder surgery, finishing with 16 points, nine rebounds, and four assists.
Donte DiVincenzo struggled with his shot but showed playmaking ability, finishing with 10 points, three assists, and two steals.
Joe Ingles was included in the rotation, playing seven minutes and recording an assist.
